title: Healthcare Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A healthcare benchmarks focus on commercial traction, customer metrics, and operational readiness. Revenue expectations are adjusted for healthcare's longer sales cycles, but investors expect clear evidence of product-market fit and a repeatable go-to-market motion. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Annual Recurring Revenue
metrics.note: ARR range for Series A healthcare. Higher end for digital health, lower for medical devices with implementation complexity.

metrics.label: Revenue Growth Rate
metrics.note: Year-over-year growth. Healthcare may have lumpy revenue due to long sales cycles—momentum and pipeline matter.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention
metrics.note: Expansion through broader deployment, additional use cases, or pricing. Strong NRR indicates product-market fit.

metrics.label: Logo Retention
metrics.note: Annual customer retention. Healthcare customers are sticky when products work—retention below 90% signals issues.

metrics.label: Customer Count
metrics.note: Active paying health systems or enterprises. Mix of customer types demonstrates broad applicability.

metrics.label: Average Contract Value
metrics.note: Annual contract value. Varies significantly by product type and health system size.

metrics.label: Sales Cycle
metrics.note: Time from first meeting to signed contract. Shortening cycles indicate GTM maturity.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Varies by delivery model. Software higher, services-intensive lower. Path to 70%+ expected.

metrics.label: CAC Payback
metrics.note: Healthcare has higher CAC due to sales complexity. Path to under 18 months expected at scale.

metrics.label: Reimbursement Coverage
metrics.note: Coverage with meaningful commercial payers. Medicare coverage often critical for scale.
